comments.commentBody: We did quite well for 150 years without an intact social safety net. We were stronger people then, and we didn't sell our votes to politicians.

President Obama is right that an intact social safety net is necessary to our prosperity and that reducing the debt on the backs of the middle class and poor both goes against our long established social contract and inhibits future growth. Immigration reform, which Republicans have blocked for eight long years, would be a shot in the arm to our demographics problem with an aging population.

He reiterated the need for a 21st century energy & climate policy, infrastructure and research & development investment, and education reform to grow jobs and the economy. I was glad to see him demolish Republicans' "takers" meme and tell science deniers they could keep their beliefs but need to get out of the way of progress. All this, and he still managed to include equity in voting rights, a return to a more fact based and civil political debate and equal rights for all, in a speech that only took 18 minutes.

It was a speech about expanding again the "We the People" spirit of our founders that produced the Emanicipation Proclamation, Women's Suffrage, the Civil Rights and the Voting Rights Acts and will now, propel equal rights for gays forward and the importance of voters engaging in the political process. It was a really big deal of a speech.
I think the NRA's idea of armed guards at schools is great. Now it should put its money where it's mouth is and pay for it instead of foisting another expense on overburdened taxpayers.

I hope we don't all classify gun control as "iffy". If we do, we start handicapped. After all, most civilized countries think guns are too dangerous, and why are they needed at all? We need to shake up our thinking on this subject and ban all deadly, dangerous devices from bazookas to nerve gas to bombs and guns.

I'm not willing to risk my family's life so some gun enthusiast can stroke his weapon and tell people what a "proud gun owner" he is.
George Will has forfeited any claim to O2 on earth. He needs to be GONE

I thought it was awesome.  He should get something on immigration reform.  Gun control is iffy.  I think he should go along with the NRA's idea of armed guards at schools and then maybe he can get stiff background checks, etc. as a compromise.  I was really angered at George Wills editorial "The health care act's death star?" in our little local conservative sheet.  Thought it was total idiocy.  Would like to hear other opinions if anyone cares to read it.  Climate change involves research projects and also the disastrous recent climate events.  So anything could happen there.  ACA is law of the land and thus should be fully enacted since the President is in full control now.  Really glad to hear Professor Krugmans recent opinion on that.

Your comments are a bit catty and cruel, but I have to say you are mostly correct. (I'd say these things privately, but not to her face!)

She just does not dress in a flattering way for her age or body type (though she's not 50 -- I think she is about 46) -- those awful belted sweaters, with the belts riding up under her bustline....you nailed that.

And that horrid hairdo, OMG....

Your TUESXWDP avatar of the day, I see is Robt. E Lee, considered by most military historians has the greatest battlefield strategist that ever lived!
However, I do think it's a bit of a stretch, John, to use 58A as your inspiration?

Howie

The existence of stories, which go beyond isolated incidents happening in a dark alley, are unfortunately available to all.
The french artist Fabienne Verdier in her autobiography recount her chilling story :
On her way to China to learn calligraphy, she had a lay over in Delhi. Because of the heat she fainted in the airport only to wake up in a bus filled with an indian soccer team.
They were drunk and it became clear very quickly that they all wanted to have their way with her. She said that she had to negotiate with the coach to only be raped by him and not the whole team.....At the end of the ordeal, she was sent back to the airport in a taxi (clearly exhibiting some Stockholm syndrome, she said the coach took "pitty" on her), bleeding profusely and on her arrival in china she had to be hospitalized...

Because he won the majority of the electoral votes, get used to it.

And I'm a 62-year-old engineer, and I voted for him.

In years past I voted for Republicans, ones I thought sane and competent.

But that is all long past -- the Republicans have gone crazy: ignorant, dog-whistle crazy.

The best thing I ever learned from my Macro Econ professor was that a mix of the two "schools" is in fact the most successful model.  No one extreme works.  We've had the mixed model since the New Deal, but now we'd like to scrap that and go for complete unregulated "trickle down".  Except nothing is trickling down, but it sure is at flood levels on its way UP!
Well, Ya'll should know that Obama's leading a secret conspiracy to create a stupidity tax ... it will eliminate the deficit because there's bottomless stupidity in the US.

Still angry that Obama won and Romney lost, eh?

Every time Democrats lose, those who can't stand it start muttering about moving to Sweden or Denmark or Canada ... and some of them do! There really are other countries which embody progressive/socialist ideals much more than the US, and are high-quality places to live.

So where might you go, eh? There aren't any, are there? Think about it.

So Professor Stiglitz is merely making this up to sell newspapers? I take it you are a Faux viewer then? Sure, they'll tell you this is merely a leftist jeremiad to sell papers - never mind the actual statistics, never mind that this has been a 30 year trend, you just stay in that Faux bubble and let the rest of us buy the newspapers.

I do think the decline of newspapers is contributing to the ignorance levels in this country, and those are a big part of the inequality problem. When you have a middle class, or in many instances a lower middle class, that roots consistently for the people who've stomped over them to amass most of the wealth, well then you do have an ignorance problem. And I for one hold Fox and all its spin off hate radio pundits as a major part of the problem.

Re: "If bad decisions don't have consequences, you subsidize failure."
Right on...too connected to fail bankers readily come to mind

In a genuine free market devoid of corporate welfare, those banks wouldn't have received bailout TARP funds in the first place and would've gone bust like they so justly deserved for their greed and incompetence.

This kind of anti union meme is typical and shows a gross over simplification of the very facts Joseph Stiglitz has mentioned in the article.
In a word hyperbolic.

By the way you are paying less taxes now then you were 30 years ago and if you are paying more in property taxes that's because of lower taxes on all levels. The cost of running state and local municipalities goes up due to idiotic planing and people like yourself insisting on services without wanting to pay for them. You blame the unions when it's clear that inequality is the real issue here.
Hyperbolic at best, that's what this comment is all about.

Why is it that you use Cuba as an example. By the way they have a better education and health care system than we do even though they are a poor nation. That said I have a few other nations that fly in the face of your right wing meme. Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Germany, Holland and Switzerland to name a few that are Social Democracies and doing pretty well.
Twenty-five percents is probably the number of homeowners that own their homes outright (no mortgage).

How about you notice that countries that have much greater equality than ours are heavily unionized, that the highest rated educational system, Finland, is 95% unionized, that when inequality was at a low after WWII, the US was heavily unionized?

How about you look at data and history instead of Fox ideology?
That misses the point of the article and is like treating the "malady" with a band aid.
That's not the reason
It's an elite mutual admiration society, with the not so subtle intention of ramping up executive pay across the board. It's a big scam.

Students are told that they will get a good job with a college education, and that without a college education they cannot hope to have a good job.

Surprise. Very few good jobs anymore.
But only living wage jobs left in our society - -for the ordinary person (not rich) -- are public sector jobs.  That is the only middle class left in our society.
But all work is work that needs to be done.  All workers deserve a living wage.  Slavery -- including wage slavery - -needs to be abolished
Another misguided Republican rant about moochers. You lost. Get over it.
The jobs are now in Asia. The 1% has decided to invest the money earned in this country with American labor -- in China.   The economy has been gutted, and it's not coming back.
